mysql_backup_db(dbname, dirname=None)¶

Compressed backup of mysql database Based on https://mcdee.com.au/python-mysql-backup-script/

Parameters:
  • dbname (str) – the name of the mysql database
  • dirname (str) – the name of the backup dirnameectory, default is home

  • dbname (str) – the name of the mysql database
  • dbname – the name of the mysql database table
  • dirname (str) – the name of the backup dirnameectory, default is home

insert_teamstats(stats, table_name, game_date)¶

Cleans merged list of team base + advanced stats

Parameters:
  • stats (list) – list of dictionaries
  • table_name (str) – examples – ‘stats.cs_teamstats’, ‘stats.teamstats’
  • game_date (str) – date through which stats are current (usually yesterday)
Returns:

cleaned_items – list of cleaned team dictionaries
Return type:

list

class nba.db.pgsql.NBAPostgres(with_db=True, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

insert_dicts(dicts_to_insert, table_name)¶

Generic routine to insert dictionary into mysql table Will rollback with any errors

Parameters:
  • dicts_to_insert (list) – list of dictionaries to insert, keys match columns
  • table_name (str) – name of database table
Returns:

None
postgres_backup_db(dbname, dirname=None)¶

Compressed backup of database

Parameters:
  • dbname (str) – the name of the database
  • dirname (str) – the name of the backup dirnameectory, default is home
Returns:

None
postgres_backup_table(dbname, tablename, username='postgres')¶

Compressed backup of mysql database table Based on https://mcdee.com.au/python-mysql-backup-script/

Parameters:
  • dbname (str) – the name of the mysql database
  • dbname – the name of the mysql database table
  • dirname (str) – the name of the backup dirnameectory, default is home
Returns:

None
select_dict(sql)¶

Generic routine to get list of dictionaries from table

Parameters:sql (str) – the select statement you want to execute
Returns:results – list of dictionaries representing rows in table
Return type:list
select_list(sql)¶

Generic routine to get list of values from one column of table

Parameters:sql (str) – the select statement you want to execute
Returns:results – list of rows in column
Return type:list
select_scalar(sql)¶

Generic routine to get a single value from a table

Parameters:sql (str) – the select statement you want to execute
Returns:type depends on the query
Return type:result
update(sql)¶

Generic routine to update table Will rollback with any errors

Parameters:sql (str) – UPDATE statement
Returns:None
